intro: Galumpita cuspidata, commonly known as the pointed leaf galumpita, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences, and bloom during the wet season. Galumpita cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
